Name: Requiring all city agencies to record and report information regarding workplace injuries and illnesses.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all city agencies to record and report information regarding workplace injuries.
BodyName: Committee on Civil Service and Labor

History.Description: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Approved by Council.

This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\fi720\ulnone\par
\pard\hyphpar0\fi-720\li2160\sa120\sl360\slmult1\qj\tx0\expndtw-3 Section 1.  Section 12-127 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding new subdivision c to read as follows:\par
\pard\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\expndtw0\ul c.  (1) Each agency shall keep a record of any workers\rquote  compensation claim filed by an employee, the subject of which concerns an injury sustained in the course of duty while such employee was employed at such agency.  Such record shall include, but not be limited to, the following data: \par
\pard\fi720\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj (i)\tab the name of the agency where such employee worked;\par
(ii)\tab such employee\rquote s title;\par
\pard\li1440\sl480\slmult1\qj (iii)\tab the date such employee or the city filed such claim with the appropriate office of the state of New York, if any;\par
(iv)\tab the date the city began to make payment for such claim, or the date such claim was established by the appropriate state office and the date the city began to make payment for such claim pursuant to such establishment, if any;\par
\pard\fi720\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj (v)\tab the date such injury occurred;\par
(vi)\tab the location at which such injury occurred; \par
\pard\li1440\sl480\slmult1\qj (vii)\tab the nature of such injury, including, but not limited to, the circumstances of such injury, the type or diagnosis of such injury and a description of how such injury occurred; \par
(viii)\tab the length of time such employee is unable to work due to such injury, if any; and\par
\pard\li1440\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1496\tx2057 (ix)\tab a list of any expenses paid as a result of such claim, including, but not limited to, expenses relating to wage replacement, medical costs, administrative costs and any penalties.\par
\pard\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj  (2)\tab Each agency shall transmit records gathered pursuant to paragraph (1) of subdivision c of this section, as soon as practicable, to the mayor of the city of New York.\par
\pard\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab\ul (3)  The mayor of the city of New York shall ensure that an annual report is prepared utilizing the records received from each city agency pursuant to paragraph (2) of subdivision c of this section.  Such report shall be transmitted to the mayor, the comptroller, the public advocate and the speaker of the council of the city of New York by the first day of May, covering the previous calendar year.  Such report shall include, but not be limited to:\par
\pard\li1440\sl480\slmult1\qj (i) \tab an analysis, with respect to each agency included in the report, of expenses paid as a result of workers\rquote  compensation claims, including, but not limited to, expenses relating to wage replacement, medical costs, administrative costs and any penalties paid by an agency;\par
(ii)\tab a list of the occurrence of specific claims for each agency and for the city as a whole;\par
(iii)\tab a list of the specific sites where injuries occurred for each agency and for the city as a whole;\par
(iv)\tab year-to-year comparisons of information compiled pursuant to this paragraph.\par
\pard\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\fi720\qj\'a72.  This local law shall take effect on January 1, 2005.\par
\pard\par
\pard\hyphpar0\par
\pard\par
